Name: Fragment of a block statue of Sen-nefer
Description: Left front upper corner of a block statue. Underneath the garment that covers the whole body, the round right elbow can clearly be seen. The left hand, which is in relief, is partly covered by the garment. The inscription on the side contains the offering formula as well as name and title of the owner. Sen-nefer may be the same person as the well-known treasurer of Tuthmosis III because of the similarity of the titles.
